directoryParameter.name: installdir
directoryParameter.title: Installation Directory
directoryParameter.explanation: Please specify the installation directory for OraAdapter.

parameterGroup.name: Property
parameterGroup.title: ALTIBASE Adapter for Oracle Property Settings: ALA

stringParameter.name: ala_sender_ip
stringParameter.explanation: This is the IP address of the server on which ALTIBASE HDB is installed.

stringParameter.name: ala_receiver_port
stringParameter.explanation: This is the reception port number used by ALTIBASE Adapter.

stringParameter.name: ala_replication_name
stringParameter.explanation: This is the name of the replication object used to send XLOGs generated by ALTIBASE HDB.

stringParameter.name: ala_xlog_pool_size
stringParameter.explanation: This is the amount of memory to allocate for the storage of XLOGs.

parameterGroup.name: Property2
parameterGroup.title: ALTIBASE Adapter for Oracle Property Settings: ALA

choiceParameter.name: ala_socket_type
choiceParameter.explanation: This is the communications protocol used by the ALA library. (ALA_SOCKET_TYPE) - If you choose "UNIX", you must install oraAdapter using the same system account that was used to install ALTIBASE HDB.

choiceParameter.name: ala_logging_active
choiceParameter.explanation: Would you like the ALA library log messages to be saved to disk?

parameterGroup.name: Property3
parameterGroup.title: ALTIBASE Adapter for Oracle Property Settings: Altibase

stringParameter.name: altibase_user
stringParameter.explanation: This is used to specify the name of a user account with which to connect to ALTIBASE HDB.

stringParameter.name: altibase_password
stringParameter.explanation: This is used to specify the password for the user account through which the connection to ALTIBASE HDB will be established.

stringParameter.name: altibase_ip
stringParameter.explanation: This is the IP address of the server on which ALTIBASE HDB is installed.

stringParameter.name: altibase_port
stringParameter.explanation: This is the number of the port at which ALTIBASE HDB listens.

parameterGroup.name: Property4
parameterGroup.title: ALTIBASE Adapter for Oracle Property Settings: Oracle

stringParameter.name: oracle_server_alias
stringParameter.explanation: Oracle server name - If this is left blank, ALTIBASE Adapter will attempt to connect to Oracle on the same machine (localhost).

labelParameter.name: desc_skip_dml
labelParameter.explanation: Enabling these properties will prevent DML(INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE) statements that are executed on the Altibase database from also being executed on the Oracle database.

choiceParameter.name: oracle_skip_insert
choiceParameter.description: Do you want to enable the ORACLE_SKIP_INSERT property?

choiceParameter.name: oracle_skip_update
choiceParameter.description: Do you want to enable the ORACLE_SKIP_UPDATE property?

choiceParameter.name: oracle_skip_delete
choiceParameter.description: Do you want to enable the ORACLE_SKIP_DELETE property?

parameterGroup.name: Property5
parameterGroup.title: ALTIBASE Adapter for Oracle Property Settings: Oracle

choiceParameter.name: oracle_asynchronous_commit
choiceParameter.description: Do you want to enable the ORACLE_ASYNCHRONOUS_COMMIT property?
choiceParameter.explanation:
"Asynchronous Commit" is a way of improving performance at the expense of durability. If the ORACLE_ASYNCHRONOUS_COMMIT property is enabled, Oracle will return a message indicating that commit is complete before logs have actually been written to disk, in order to improve performance.
Note, however, that this may cause some data synchronization problems if a fault develops in the Oracle server.

choiceParameter.name: oracle_group_commit
choiceParameter.description: Do you want to enable the ORACLE_GROUP_COMMIT property?
choiceParameter.explanation: "Group Commit" improves overall performance, but increases the amount of time it takes to commit individual transactions. If the ORACLE_GROUP_COMMIT property is enabled, multiple ALTIBASE HDB transactions will be committed in Oracle at the same time, in order to improve performance.

parameterGroup.name: Property6
parameterGroup.title: ALTIBASE Adapter for Oracle Property Settings: Oracle

stringParameter.name: oracle_array_dml_max_size
stringParameter.explanation:
"Array DML" means grouping multiple DML statements. This realizes a performance improvement by reducing network costs.
The ORACLE_ARRAY_DML_MAX_SIZE property sets the maximum number of DML statements that are grouped in this way. - It improves performance when the ORACLE_GROUP_COMMIT property is enabled. - At present, this property only affects the INSERT and DELETE statements. - To disable Array DML, set the ORACLE_ARRAY_DML_MAX_SIZE property to 1.

stringParameter.name: oracle_update_statement_cache_size
stringParameter.explanation:
Statement caching improves performance by caching executable statements that are used repeatedly, such as in a loop or in a method that is called repeatedly.
The ORACLE_UPDATE_STATEMENT_CACHE_SIZE property is used to set the size of the cache in which prepared UPDATE statements are stored. - Because the INSERT and DELETE statements already have their own cache, only UPDATE statements are stored in this cache. - If this property is set to 0, oraAdapter does not cache UPDATE statements.

infoParameter.name: property_report
infoParameter.title: Property Review
infoParameter.value:
To change these properties after installation is complete, please modify the following file : ${installdir}/conf/oraAdapter.conf
1. ALTIBASE Adapter for Oracle Property Settings : ALA
1) ALA_SENDER_IP : [${ala_sender_ip}]
2) ALA_RECEIVER_PORT : [${ala_receiver_port}]
3) ALA_REPLICATION_NAME : [${ala_replication_name}]
4) ALA_XLOG_POOL_SIZE : [${ala_xlog_pool_size}]
5) ALA_SOCKET_TYPE : [${ala_socket_type}]
6) ALA_LOGGING_ACTIVE : [${ala_logging_active_tmp}]
2. ALTIBASE Adapter for Oracle Property Settings : Altibase
1) ALTIBASE_USER : [${altibase_user}]
2) ALTIBASE_PASSWORD : [${altibase_password}]
3) ALTIBASE_IP : [${altibase_ip}]
4) ALTIBASE_PORT : [${altibase_port}]
3. ALTIBASE Adapter for Oracle Property Settings : Oracle Database
1) ORACLE_SERVER_ALIAS : [${oracle_server_alias}]
2) ORACLE_USER : [${oracle_user}]
3) ORACLE_PASSWORD : [${oracle_password}]
4) ORACLE_SKIP_INSERT : [${skip_insert}]
5) ORACLE_SKIP_UPDATE : [${skip_update}]
6) ORACLE_SKIP_DELETE : [${skip_delete}]
7) ORACLE_ASYNCHRONOUS_COMMIT : [${asynchronous_commit}]
8) ORACLE_GROUP_COMMIT : [${group_commit}]
9) ORACLE_ARRAY_DML_MAX_SIZE : [${array_dml_max_size}]
10) ORACLE_UPDATE_STATEMENT_CACHE_SIZE : [${update_statement_cache_size}]
